concept.title: Installing the HTTP Module for tc Server
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes how to install the HTTP session management module with tc Server templates.

ol.li: If you do not already have tc Server, download and install the product from the VMware tc Server download page or the Pivotal tc Server download page. These instructions require tc Server 2.1 or later. (If you are using an older version of tc Server, you should set up the plug-in without templates: .)

If you have not already downloaded and installed 8.1, download and install 8.0 from the download page as described in .
The HTTP Session Management Module for tc Server is included in the installation package. After you install , you can find both modules in the following location: $GEMFIRE/tools/Modules/Pivotal_GemFire_Modules-8.X.X-tcServer.zipor$GEMFIRE/tools/Modules/Pivotal_GemFire_Modules-8.X.X-tcServer30.zip
where $GEMFIRE is the location where you installed and 8.X.X corresponds to the version of the HTTP Session Management Module (for tc Server 2.X or tc Server 3.0) you are installing.
Unzip the module into the Pivotal tc Server $CATALINA_HOME/templates directory so that it creates gemfire-p2p and gemfire-cs subdirectories within the tc Server templates directory.

Copy the following jar files to the lib directory of your tc server ($CATALINA_HOME/lib):
$GEMFIRE/lib/gemfire.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/antlr.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/spring-core-3.2.12.RELEASE.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/spring-shell-1.0.0.RELEASE.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/log4j-api-2.1.jar
$GEMFIRE/lib/log4j-core-2.1.jar
